Name: Figurine of a baboon on a socle
Description: This limestone figurine, of which the provenance is not known, represents a cynocephalus crouched on a socle, the hands placed on the knees. The chest is decorated by an amulet taking the form of a small naos. It's probably a figurine of the god Thoth symbolised by his sacred animal, the baboon. The piece, of which the upper part is badly damaged, dates from the New Kingdom.
